pullRequest.body:
Define the extremal number `extremalNumber β A` of a finite type `β` and a simple graph `A`: `extremalNumber β A` is the maximum number of edges in a `A`-free simple graph on the vertex type `β`, if `A` is contained in all simple graphs on the vertex type `β`, then this is `0`.

Also define

- the type of subgraph isomorphisms `SubgraphIso` as the subtype of *injective* homomorphisms,
- the predicate that a simple graph contains another simple graph `IsIsoSubgraph`,
- the predicate that a simple graph is free of another simple graph `Free` for convenience ,
- the predicate that a simple graph is an extremal graph `IsExtremal` satisfying some predicate,

and prove lemmas/theorems about these definitions.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [f77e510b8a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19865/commits/f77e510b8a9d3e19f80ff7ffb65c519d7a59ed8a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Extremal.Basic` (new file)|731|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Embedding.toSubgraphIso`
`+ Free`
`+ Hom.toSubgraphIso`
`+ IsExtremal`
`+ IsIsoSubgraph`
`+ IsIsoSubgraph.trans`
`+ IsIsoSubgraph.trans'`
`+ Iso.toSubgraphIso`
`+ Subgraph.coe_isIsoSubgraph`
`+ Subgraph.isoMap`
`+ Subgraph.subgraphIso`
`+ SubgraphIso`
`+ _`
`+ asEmbedding`
`+ coe_toHom`
`+ coe_toHom_apply`
`+ comp`
`+ comp_apply`
`+ exists_extremal_graph`
`+ exists_extremal_graph_of_free`
`+ exists_iso_subgraph`
`+ extremalNumber`
`+ extremalNumber_eq_extremalNumber_of_iso`
`+ extremalNumber_le_extremalNumber_of_isIsoSubgraph`
`+ extremalNumber_le_iff`
`+ extremalNumber_le_iff_of_nonneg`
`+ extremalNumber_lt`
`+ free_bot`
`+ free_iff_of_iso`
`+ induce`
`+ injective`
`+ instance : FunLike (A ≲g B) α β`
`+ isExtremal_free_iff`
`+ isIsoSubgraph_iff_exists_iso_subgraph`
`+ isIsoSubgraph_iff_of_iso`
`+ isIsoSubgraph_of_isEmpty`
`+ isIsoSubgraph_of_isEmpty_edgeSet`
`+ isIsoSubgraph_of_le`
`+ isIsoSubgraph_refl`
`+ isIsoSubgraph_trans`
`+ isIsoSubgraph_trans'`
`+ le_extremalNumber`
`+ lt_extremalNumber_iff`
`+ lt_extremalNumber_iff_of_nonneg`
`+ mapEdgeSet`
`+ mapNeighborSet`
`+ ofLE`
`+ refl`
`+ toHom`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This is the first of a few PRs for a formalisation of the Erdős-Stone-Simonovits theorem. I created the new directory `Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Extremal` as I intend to put a couple files here that really only pertain to extremal graph theory, e.g., Turán density.

The definitions in this PR do generalise a couple existing definitions, e.g., `IsTuranMaximal r` iff `IsExtremal (·.CliqueFree (r+1))` in `Turan.lean`. If this PR is successful it might be worth rewriting bits of `Turan.lean` using these common definitions, e.g.,
```
theorem extremalNumber_completeGraph
    (β α : Type*) [Fintype β] [DecidableEq β] [Fintype α] [Nontrivial α] :
    extremalNumber β (completeGraph α) =
      (turanGraph (Fintype.card β) (Fintype.card α-1)).edgeFinset.card := sorry
```
```
theorem card_edgeFinset_eq_extremalNumber_completeGraph_iff_iso_turanGraph
    {β: Type*} [Fintype β] (G : SimpleGraph β) [DecidableRel G.Adj]
    (α : Type*) [Fintype α] [Nontrivial α] :
    (completeGraph α).Free G ∧
        G.edgeFinset.card = extremalNumber β (completeGraph α)
      ↔ Nonempty (G ≃g turanGraph (Fintype.card β) (Fintype.card α-1)) := sorry
```

Thank you for the PR! I have written a version of this a year and a half ago [here](https://github.com/YaelDillies/LeanCamCombi/blob/master/LeanCamCombi/Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Containment.lean). I can't really type in the foreseeable future now, so I will just say that there is potential to make both APIs nicer by combining them

> Thank you for the PR! I have written a version of this a year and a half ago [here](https://github.com/YaelDillies/LeanCamCombi/blob/master/LeanCamCombi/Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Containment.lean). I can't really type in the foreseeable future now, so I will just say that there is potential to make both APIs nicer by combining them

@YaelDillies It is interesting to see how similar the code is in some places. I also had some code implementing essentially your `labelledCopyCount`, but didn't PR it cause I don't need it for Erdős-Stone-Simonovits. I also tried to implement `copyCount` instead by counting classes of subgraph isomorphisms under the equivalence `fun f₁ f₂ : A ≲g B ↦ ∃ h : B ≲g B, f₁ = h.comp f₂`, but didn't know enough about Lean at the time to realize it properly (and haven't thought about it since).

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): define extremalNumber
